products.product_name: Huggies Simply Clean Unscented Baby Diaper Wipes, 11 Flip-Top Packs (704 Wipes Total), Packaging May Vary

reviews.title: These Huggie Wipes Are Awesome: Their Not Just For Babies.
reviews.name: Anj
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2024
reviews.review:
I'VE BEEN USING THIS PARTICULAR HUGGIES WIPES FOR SEVERAL YEARS.

I used to use a different brand of wipes. But after a couple of years of buying them, the manufacturer went cheap and changed the material to such an inferrior cloth, that the material would fall apart and leave a bunch of loose cotton all over your skin. NOT GOOD. Becuase now you have to actually wash it off. That's when I switched to Huggies, and have been using them for at least five (5) years.

MANY USAGES:
I take these wipes with me everywhere, because you never know when you'll need them. And particularly in the Summer, when it's hot and muggy out; I use them to clean and cool off my face, arms and legs, etc... And no matter where I am, when I'm away from home, I always run into moms who needs one for her child. These wipes come in handy for cleaning faces and hands after a meal, while on the run or at home.

TEXTURE:
These wipes are sturdy and easy to manage with one hand. Their more than just wipes, their like wash cloths. They don't fall apart, their super soft, and have enough moisture in them to clean your parts effectively. The package says their hypoallergenic, and I believe it, because my family have been using this brand for many years, and no one has broken out from them. We love them, especially for the bathroom.

LIKE WASHING WITH WATER:
Another good use is using the wipes like your're washing your hands with water. I carry a wad of these wipes with me when on the go, so when I'm away from home and really need to give my hands a wash, I just squeeze the soapy water out the wipe into my hand and rub both hands together, as if to be washing my hands with soap and water. Then I use the wipe to finish the job. Works every time.

EASY TO OPEN FLIP-TOP:
I like this brand of Huggies for many reasons, and the easy flip top was one of the main reasons I keep coming back. You can actually flip the top open and closed with one hand, which I do frequently. So, that's a feature that comes in handy when I don't have both hands available.

PRICE IS COST EFFECTIVE:
As you know, wipes can be very expenseive; $4, $5 or more just for one pack, and not get many wipes either. Many times the local store runs out of the brand you like, and you're stuck paying a lot of money for a small pack and a brand you're not familiar with. This particular item of Huggies, sold on Amazon comes in a bundle of 11 flip-top packs, so you'll have plenty on hand for a long time. AND THE PRICE IS GREAT, TOO; I bought this item in October 2023, and paid less than $19 dollars, including taxes. With 11 packs in the bundle, that makes the average price for one pack less than $2 bucks!

RECOMMEND?: Absolutely! I recommend this item to anyone who wants a wipe thats super soft, hypoallergenic, has lots of soap and water and cleans like a wash cloth. Oh, the size is great too!

reviews.title: Thick and durable wipes for the most sensitive of skins
reviews.name: T
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2024
reviews.review:
I’ve been using Huggies Simply Clean Wipes for over two years now, and I couldn’t be more satisfied with their performance. These wipes are incredibly versatile, working perfectly on the face, body, and bum, making them a must-have for every member of the household. My toddler, who has eczema and sensitive skin, has never had any issues with these wipes, which is a huge relief.

One of the standout features of these wipes is their thickness. They are durable enough to handle messes without worrying about them tearing or separating from the pack. I also appreciate the design of the packaging, as it doesn't give me too much trouble when I’m pulling out a wipe, ensuring a smooth and hassle-free experience.

Another great benefit is the value. The bulk pack is a fantastic deal, especially considering how well these wipes perform for such a reasonable price. Whether for cleaning up after meals or for quick on-the-go messes, Huggies Simply Clean Wipes have been a reliable, everyday essential in our home. Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Quality and gentle care
reviews.name: Traci Barnes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2024
reviews.review:
Top-Notch Quality and Gentle Care

Huggies Baby Wipes are an absolute must-have for parents seeking reliable, high-quality wipes that are gentle on delicate skin. These wipes are thick, soft, and have just the right amount of moisture, making clean-up easy and efficient without having to use a ton of wipes. They’re durable enough to handle even the toughest messes without tearing, which makes diaper changes quicker and less messy.

The formula is gentle and hypoallergenic, free from harsh chemicals, so it’s safe for sensitive skin and leaves babies feeling fresh without irritation. Huggies also offers different varieties like fragrance-free and aloe-infused options to suit specific needs, which is a thoughtful touch.

Overall, Huggies Baby Wipes combine durability, softness, and skin-safe ingredients, making them a fantastic choice for parents who want only the best for their babies. Highly recommended!

reviews.title: For Babies, Adults, and Questionable Life Choices
reviews.name: hrh
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2025
reviews.review:
These wipes may be unscented, but trust me, their power is LOUD. They have cleaned up everything from baby messes to my own questionable snack-time decisions. Dropped nachos on my shirt? Huggies wipe. Toddler covered in mystery goo? Huggies wipe. Makeup smudged because I sneezed mid-eyeliner? Huggies wipe.

They’re soft, strong, and just the right amount of moist (yes, I said it). No weird smells, no irritation, just pure, unproblematic cleaning magic in a flip-top pack. Honestly, I don’t know how I survived before these. At this point, I should probably start paying rent for the space they take up in my purse.

reviews.title: 5 Stars – Fantastic Quality and Great Value!
reviews.name: Dee
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2025
reviews.review:
I’ve been using the Huggies Simply Clean Fragrance-Free Baby Wipes for a while now, and I’m extremely happy with my purchase! These wipes are definitely a standout in terms of both quality and price. Here’s my detailed review:

Pros:
Excellent Quality: These wipes are soft, strong, and don’t tear easily, even when wiping tough messes. They’re gentle enough on my baby’s sensitive skin but still provide thorough cleaning.

Fragrance-Free: I love that these are unscented. Many wipes have overpowering scents that can irritate my baby’s skin, but these are completely fragrance-free, which makes them ideal for sensitive skin.

Leakproof Packaging: The flip-top packs are fantastic! They seal securely, so I’ve never had any leaks or dried-out wipes. The design is practical and keeps the wipes fresh for a long time.

Great Value: For the price, you get 704 wipes spread across 11 packs. This is an amazing deal, especially considering the quality of the product. They last a long time, and I feel like I’m getting my money’s worth.

No Bad Odor: Some baby wipes can have a weird chemical smell, but these wipes have no bad odor at all. They’re completely neutral, which is important to me as I want something gentle for my baby.

Versatile Use: These wipes are not just for diaper changes! I use them for cleaning up spills, wiping hands, and even for quick clean-ups when we’re on the go. They’re great for the whole family.

Cons:
Slightly Thin: While the wipes are strong, they are a little thinner compared to some other premium brands. This isn’t a huge issue, but I’ve found that I sometimes need to use two wipes for bigger messes.

Flip-Top Can Be Hard to Open One-Handed: The flip-top lid is convenient, but it can be a bit tricky to open with one hand when you’re holding your baby. This is a minor inconvenience but worth noting.

Final Thoughts:
Overall, I am very pleased with these Huggies Simply Clean Wipes. They’re affordable, gentle on the skin, and do the job perfectly. The leakproof packs, lack of fragrance, and strong yet soft texture make them a great choice for anyone with babies or young children. I highly recommend them – you get a lot for the price and quality!

reviews.review: I first bought these at Walmart because I needed a wipe for my hands and face while I’m in my car eating on lunch breaks. I liked it so much I ordered a pack of them. These also come in handy when I have my nieces and nephews with me. Not only can they use it for their hands and face too, but also for their bottoms in public (I can too)! It’s not super wet like other baby wipes, so it does tend to leave some pieces if you wipe your hands and then touch something while they are still wet (my black work pants in this case), but I’d still prefer to wipe my bottom with these than other baby wipes. I also like that it’s not scented, nor does it leave a chemical feel or smell on you like some hand wipes do.

reviews.review:
Been buying these for years! After trying many brands and types of wipes, these are the clear winner! Best quality and durability and fair price. No smell. No sticky residue. Great for baby diapers but for many other uses too.
The only annoying part is how sometimes it’s hard to pull out just one, and a whole bunch come out
Also the part that you’re supposed to rip open could be made a bit better

reviews.title: Best deal for the price
reviews.name: Doug Blasco
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2024
reviews.review:
I have been using these water whips for years now and I haven't found anything else that I like more. They are a great deal for the case, because I use them for absolutely everything.
Washing my makeup, add a few drops of oil to break up my mascara and off it comes, no irritation. I keep them in the car, no sticky hands or spills for me. They are great for sprucing up the dashboards while the gas in filling up, they are super strong and last while scrubbing that coffee off your floorboards.
They are wonderful for cleaning puppy dog ears and tear stains, no risk of anything other than water. Iam telling you I use them on everything. They work great next to the potty for a quick clean up, if you know what I mean.
They are just water, so if they get a bit dry, because you left the cap open? I put fresh water in the pack and they are good to go. Add warm water and you have a sponge bath in a pinch.
I highly recommend these for all your needs.
Cheers 🍷

These are the only wipes that I buy for my son. I’ve been using these now for three years. I’ve tried almost every single wipe out there and none seem to be this good and value for my money. They’re soft but thick enough to hold up to…well… blow outs. I love that there is not a scent and do not have lotion or other additives. The wipes are nice and thick. I always keep a pack in every room because they’re great for also spills or a quick wipe down. Even my teenager uses these sometimes to wipe his face and hands when we’re out and about.

Update: I’m deducting one star because Huggies has changed the thickness of the wipes. They’re a bit softer but don’t feel as effective as they used to be. Huggies- please go back to the original thickness!

reviews.review: Like a "kneenex" box, the edge of the wipe is supposed to be sticking out to grab and when you pull it out it should come easily and give one wipe and leave the next one grabable. Super frustrating every time but the wipes themselves are nice cheap and easy on skin.

reviews.title: Convenient and Gentle Baby Wipes
reviews.name: Jorge Alberto Sarmiento
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2023
reviews.review:
I recently purchased the Huggies Simply Clean Fragrance-Free Baby Wipes, and overall, I am quite satisfied with their performance. The pack contains 11 individual packs, totaling 704 wipes, making it a great value for money. The wipes are a lifesaver for quick clean-ups and diaper changes, especially when I'm on the go.

One of the standout features of these wipes is their fragrance-free formula, ensuring my baby's sensitive skin is not exposed to any unnecessary irritants. The wipes are gentle and soft, providing a comfortable experience for my little one.

Another positive aspect is their effectiveness in cleaning messes. They do a fantastic job of wiping away dirt and grime, leaving my baby's skin feeling fresh and clean.

The packaging design is also convenient. The wipes are well-sealed, preventing them from drying out, and the flip-top lid allows for easy one-handed access when dealing with a wriggling baby.

However, one minor concern I have noticed on occasion is that the wipes tend to tear while pulling them out of the package. While this doesn't happen all the time, it can be a bit frustrating during those moments when you need a wipe quickly.

In conclusion, Huggies Simply Clean Fragrance-Free Baby Wipes are an excellent choice for parents seeking gentle and effective wipes for their little ones. The pack offers great value, and the wipes themselves are gentle and efficient. Despite the occasional tearing issue, I still find them to be a reliable option and would recommend them to other parents looking for convenient and fragrance-free baby wipes.

reviews.title: Reliable and Comfortable Little Movers Diapers for Active Babies, But at a Higher Price Point
reviews.name: Colaris Checo
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2023
reviews.review:
As a parent who has used Huggies Little Movers diapers, I can say that they are a great choice for active babies. The contoured shape of the diaper fits snugly around the legs and waist, which helps to prevent leaks, even during playtime. The wetness indicator is also a helpful feature that makes it easy to know when it's time for a diaper change.
One thing I particularly like about these diapers is how soft and comfortable they feel. The breathable outer layer helps to keep my baby's skin dry and healthy, which is important to me. I also appreciate that they come in a range of sizes, ensuring that I can find the perfect fit for my little one.
However, one downside to these diapers is that they are more expensive than some other options on the market. Additionally, they may not work as well for babies with very sensitive skin, as they do contain some fragrances and other materials that could potentially cause irritation.
Overall, I would definitely recommend Huggies Little Movers diapers to other parents, particularly those with active babies who need a diaper that can keep up with them. While they may be a bit pricier than some other options, I think the quality and reliability of these diapers make them well worth the investment.

reviews.title: Great wipes but not suited for us
reviews.name: Nadz
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.review:
I have been using Pampers sensitive wipes for my baby, however, I saw these Huggies - over 700 wipes for less than twenty bucks and thought what could go wrong?

They are great wipes - they get the job done but I reverted to pampers for 2 reasons:

1. The individual sheets were not as moist as Pampers - so it takes more wipes to get the job done
2. They are super thick, almost washcloth-like, but lack that gentle on-the-skin, silk feel when wiping

The scent was perfect - nothing to overwhelm my baby, and who could beat the wipes count for that price? But I could not move past the lack of wipes moisture and the absence of the silky, smooth glide when wiping.

That said, they are not a bad buy at all if none of the above matters to you.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2024
reviews.review:
This is a modal window.

No compatible source was found for this media.
So I absolutely love Huggies wipes. The thickness is perfect. They’re great at getting everything off. However, these wipe lids suck. Mine keep ripping off the packaging, and I’m not doing anything abnormal with them. My wipes then dry out quicker because I can’t keep them sealed properly.

reviews.title: Sudsy, great for big messes
reviews.name: Jane the Brain
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2023
reviews.review: These wipes are the best for heavily soiled babies, hands, faces, or items. I feel like they’re a waste for light messes, but they are easy to tear in half without coming apart while wiping. They are weirdly sudsy but that helps cut the grime. Great for dirty diapers, makeup removal, and spit baths. I wish they came in the tall refill packs because I prefer those dispensers and I think the plastic cap on these is a waste of plastic. No fragrance—just how I like it. My second favorite wipe ever (next to Huggies other fragrance free wipes in the refill packs). I always have some of these in my house but I’ve got the other Huggies wipes on Subscribe & Save.

reviews.review: These wipes are great, however, really upset how Amazon kept changing the hours for the rush delivery. I chose 7 AM-11 AM rush delivery. Then it got changed to 11 AM-3 PM without my knowledge. Package still didnt arrive. I checked my email only to find the hours upon arrival were changed AGAIN to 5 PM-10 PM. reviews.title: Work just fine! But if you look for softness try smth else.

Initially: I was Very dissapointed. Its for grown-ups, because babie's butts wouldnt handle it. Im a mom of 20 month old twin-girls. Its very thin, very rough, and you will have to dig almost every other tissue, as they are not pulling one after another .
I decided to save a few bucks, and regreated. (Better spend time and go for Kirkland tissues-price-wise and good quality, or spend an extra $$ for your babie's comfort). Will keep a full box for myself.
(Lol! Good for hemorrhoids...)- still true.

reviews.title: Good value but not for sensitive skin. Wish it was JUST WATER!
reviews.name: Traveling Fool
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2023
reviews.review: I liked these for a while because of the insane value but my babe started getting bad rashes recently anytime I use them. When I switch to M@ma Be@r water wipes, rashes heal quickly and don't recur... as those wipes are just water and are super soft. These are not soft, but are quite thick, so I dry them out and use them as dry wipes for absorbing purposes around the changing table instead. We went through a case with no issues before, but I guess I'll go back to the Water wipes to avoid rashes.

reviews.title: I have a 2 yr old and I don't have to buy a box but once a month!

I mean it is rather stupid to fill a box and leave one spot empty so it looks like one is missing just to keep it at 11. Just add the 12th one in and call it a day. An actual complete box. Price would be even better if they made it an even 12 for the box. But over all good deal, i just found that rather stupid when i opened the box and was like well that is dumb.

reviews.review: too wet.. thick tho…

reviews.title: Tend To Tear
reviews.name: Lin
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2022
reviews.review: I wanted to love these wipes. The positives are that they are fabulous for sensitive skin and are soft and thick. Unfortunately they tend to tear when pulling them out of the pack. I've had to resort to taking the few out that I need unfolded. This works but makes more work for me. So I'm of two opinions here or I would have given five stars. Maybe I'm just clumsy and you'll have better luck. This is a good value and Huggies is a champ when it comes to wipes.

reviews.title: Multi use wipes.
reviews.name: PattyT
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2018
reviews.review:
I picked up a couple of packs of HUGGIES Simply Clean Fragrance-Free Baby Wipes Soft Pack, 64 Count for use in our camper. We don't always have running water close by and we like to use moist wipes for our hands, as alternative to toilet paper, and on surfaces. I don't like the wipes that have a heavy fragrance so I was happy to see that these were unscented.

Although these are not antibacterial, they seem fine. They are durable and don't rip easy. They are multi use for us. We can keep our hands clean and also use the wipes on surfaces. We even have wiped down our Yorkie's paws with these when she got muddy. I think the price for only 64 is higher than other wipes though and these are no better than those. I will use what I have but buy wipes in larger quantities to save money.

reviews.title: Can't go wrong with huggies
reviews.name: Lady_Arwen
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2023
reviews.review: I go through these things like crazy. I work in a dusty area that can be hard to keep clean and I'm not close to a sink of any kind, so I use them all day to keep my hands and work area wiped down. Have tried cheaper brands and these are my faves.

reviews.title: Good wipes for the price
reviews.name: MaryJane Timmons
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2023
reviews.review: These wipes are a little thin but for the amount you get for the price I can’t complain. I have used these sense my son was born and he turned 9 months in 2 days. I have only had to buy 2 boxes of these wipes the whole time he has been alive. I am needing more wipes soon and I will be definitely buying another box of these!!

reviews.title: Can be obnoxious to use.
reviews.name: Zodwraith
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2022
reviews.review:
They're wipes. They work fine as wipes. No purfume and they haven't bothered my daughter's skin.

The "obnoxious" part is they constantly only give you one wipe without lifting the next wipe in the stack. This is extremely annoying when you're using one hand to hold the baby's butt in the air and only have one hand free to try and get another wipe out without grabbing 3. Why can't wipes makers find the balance between this and getting a nonstop string of wipes?

reviews.title: Our favorite wipes, but for the 3rd time we've ordered and it's missing an entire pack of wipes
reviews.name: Jazmine Cooke
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2022
reviews.review: I'll start by saying I NEVER take the time to leave product reviews. However these are our favorite baby wipes and we have tried them all! My son's skin is incredibly sensitive and we have never had an issue with these. The only thing that has held me back from a 5 star review is that for the 3rd time in a row I have ordered these wipes and they have arrived at my home missing an entire package from the box. Mind you Amazon has remedied the situation everytime. It just becomes such a nuisance that I never get exactly what I ordered the 1st time. Other than that we love these. I have always found them gentle, soft, and easy to use.

reviews.title: Love the wipes

reviews.review: We get more for our money when we order bulk online instead of the smaller boxes in-person. It gets the job done.

reviews.title: Not too bad. A good starter pack.
reviews.name: William mogg
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2021
reviews.review:
It tears very easily, which is good when I want to save the wipes and rip them in half. But it's bad when they get caught on the dispenser hole and tear when I try to pull them out.
I think it would also be better if the wipes were interlaced so that when you pull one out the next one comes up. The way it is now, I have to dig for the wipe and sometimes it's a little hard to find the edge of the next wipe.
I do wish it could be more moist.

In general, it's been a good set of wipes. They do stay together while I'm cleaning my baby's mess. Nothing soaks through the wipe. Again, I like that I can tear it in half to save the wipes.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2023
reviews.review: I love these wipes. They're the only ones I have found that maintain moisture that you can actually see on the wipe. It's nice because then you can use minimal. There is no scent to them. The only thing is that it holds so much water that sometimes trying to get them out of the pack, they tear and you have to fish the rest of it out. Not a big deal to me though, I'll continue buying these.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2022

This is really good for the price.

That's why I'm thinking of repurchasing it and recommend it.

The reason I subtracted one star is that my baby's butt turns red when using wet wipes too much.
I know it's because my baby's skin is sensitive, but I want even that to be solved.

reviews.title: As described
reviews.name: Scooter Jones
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2022
reviews.review: I use wipes to clean my face at night before I sleep and after I wake up. I like these wipes because the way they're folded makes it easy to extract 1 wipe at a time, unlike some other wipes I've used that bunch together and you end up extracting more wipes than needed. I will definitely buy these again when needed.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2025
reviews.review:
Pros: No fragrance, good value, good packaging.
Cons: Lacking in moisture, rip/disintegrate easily.
I wanted to love these due to the awesome price. These are a great value but when it comes to quality, you can tell why they are cheaper. These do not compare to the P a m p e r s Ultra Sensitive wipes. I reach for the other when we have #2s but these work fine for #1s. I am finishing off my box but we will not be re-ordering. These had great reviews, so I am starting to wonder if all those people giving rave reviews have even tried other baby wipes. Honestly the P.C sensitive wipes at WalMart work better than these. When your baby has a #2 and poop is everywhere you don’t want your finger ripping through the wipes & having to use half the pack to get the job done due to the lack of moisture.

reviews.title: I'd pass on these wipes

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2025
reviews.review:
I've bought these wipes a few different times because they always seem like such a good deal. But then I remember that they tear so easily which is very frustrating. The way they are designed, the wipes are attached to the next one, so it's impossible to only pull out one wipe at a time. Quality control is also bad.

For the price, I'd personally buy Target's store brand over these.

reviews.title: packages leaked
reviews.name: Teresa Ganse
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2024
reviews.review: when I opened up the package bundle of 3, the inside of the package was wet, and really wet on the bottom. Not sure what packaged leaked, I started to use the top package because I had ran out of and needed them. Was disappointed since I really like this brand.

reviews.title: Recent case: packets fragranced on the outside
reviews.name: Steve Chalmers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.review:
We have been buying this product, in various forms, since our children were in diapers 30 years ago.

30 years.

We use them mostly for personal care, occasionally for cleaning.

My Amazon Subscribe and Save shows I've bought 18 cases in the current form.

The most recent case Amazon delivered unexpectedly had so much fragrance on the outside of each of the pouches in the case, that not only did I have to discard the case unopened (the fragrance was far too intense for me to possibly put the case in the car long enough to get it to a charity, or to a UPS store to return it), but it contaminated other items in that Amazon shipment box which I also had to discard.

I'm a 30 year customer.

If this happens again, I will select another brand and not look back.

I don't really care if it was an extraordinary manufacturing defect, or some clown at Huggies thought it was a cute idea to put fragrance on the outside of packages of fragrance free product.

You put intense fragrance on the inside of my fragrance free home, between the time I opened the case, and the time it was in the middle of the driveway. Fortunately, no one at my home has COPD so your error did not risk killing someone, only setting off a few people's asthma in a non life threatening way.

Don't. Put. Fragrance. On. The. Outside. Of. Products. Which. Are. Marked. Fragrance. Free.

reviews.title: No me gustaron.
reviews.name: Vid@
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2024
reviews.review: No me gustaron mucho pues la pasas y deja como algo de espuma blanca.

reviews.title: Works well
reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2024
reviews.review: Wipes work well with the moisture level always seem great! Not user friendly in terms of getting out of the package, they tend to stick together more than other brands I’ve used. But overall for the price they work well.

reviews.title: Baby Wipes,
reviews.name: Kindle Customer
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2024
reviews.review: Pampers more flexible don't tear as easily and are longer.....

reviews.title: Thick not as soft
reviews.name: Brittany
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2024
reviews.review:
I was using other wipes but since I love Huggies diapers I figured I’d get the same great quality for the price but that isn’t the case. I open the pack and put them in my diaper warmer and I have NOT used them without the warmer.
The wipe is thick but it doesn’t feel super soft . I think the thickness of the wipe can make it feel like jasmine it’s a soft wipe but isn’t very soft. These don’t glide easily on my newborns skin as others did. It does take a few extra wipes to get him all clean. For the price I paid for the large quantity, I’m basically getting the same amount of wipes as other brands since I have to use more to get a good clean.
Do they work? Yes
Would I repurchase? I don’t think so

reviews.review: I have been buying these for years to use on my bedridden mother. The last batch is a different type of wipe, it’s hard like a napkin from a fast food restaurant and the top half of the pack is a bit dry. I’m going to buy a smaller pack to see if this was just a bad batch or if this is a permanent switch. If permanent, I will not be buying again. With that being said, the folks complaining about their box missing one pack are wrong. You get 11 packs not 12, each level has 4 packs so obviously the top level will have 3 packs instead of 4.

reviews.title: Convenient but could be thicker
reviews.name: Carlos J
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.review:
They do provide convenience and functionality but it does need improve in some areas. The package contains 64 unscented wipes which is amazing for some months, it has an EZ pull dispensing feature which makes it easy to grab the wipes without wasting sheets which adds to the convenience.

The have a ph balance formula which is gentle on the skin making them perfect for my baby since it has sensitive skin, however these wipes are free of many harsh ingredients I have found that they could be slightly thinner than expected which sometimes makes them less effective for some problems.

reviews.title: Very thin wipes
reviews.name: Marcus L Roose
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2024
reviews.review: We switched from pampers to save a bit of money, but quickly realized we were using more wipes than we used to. They sometimes would rip pulling them out of the bag or worse when you wiped. We will be switching back!

reviews.title: These are decent but pretty rough texture
reviews.name: KD
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2024
reviews.review:

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2024

reviews.title: Weirdly stiff and don’t seem to have much moisture
reviews.name: sch
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2024
reviews.review: I like Huggies products. These are not my favorite. They don’t perform that well and seem to have more dryness then usual. They leave little fuzzies behind on the skin.

reviews.title: Durable/strong, but not soft
reviews.name: Michelle
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2022
reviews.review: My son had a red bum while I used these and they were rather uncomfortable for him. After a couple days of use he finally cried "not those ones" and it clicked as to why he was more upset at every diaper change than usual. I felt awful for not noticing. They are not very soft at all. They are strong and will hold up well, but they are a bit rough for delicate areas. He also freaked out when I tried these on his face. They are fragrance free, and don't smell particularly strong or anything but there is a slight unpleasant scent to them. I'm not sure if it was the scent or the texture/hardness to them that he didn't like on his face. (To be fair, sometimes he just doesn't like me wiping his face and it might have happened regardless of the wipe). I will use the remainder on myself or for other things, but not on my son. I thought it was a good value though, but my son needs something a bit softer.

reviews.title: It came missing a package

reviews.title: Wipe is fine, but can be hard to take out

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2022

Given some packs were fine, I think there may have been some quality control issues. This makes it tremendously annoying when you really want to pull for another wipe but have to use both hands to fish out the next wipe. Because of this annoyance that happened in multiple boxes, I'd wait till after the QA issues to buy more

Both boxes it came in wasn’t even sealed or even taped shut, so as to be open to spiders or germs or dirt etc, that is why the 3 star rating instead of five, hopefully that’s not the norm. This is my experience with this product but may not be yours. Hope this helps

reviews.title: Just okay

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2023

I've also tried Pampers and Target generic brand wipes, and my favorite are the Pampers Sensitive.

reviews.title: These ok not bad.

reviews.title: Not as pictured
reviews.name: Anita Idleman
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2022
reviews.review: The wipes themselves are good—standard Huggies wipes, however, the packaging is different. I bought a case based on the picture of the package flip top going to the side. I have found the side flip top easier to use one-handed. When opening to the side, the package stays stable and the lid stays open. The case I received—all 11 of the packages flip top goes to the back (as pictured in my review photo. I am not happy about that!!! Either update the product photo, or ship the right product.

reviews.title: Soapy wipes
reviews.name: Halie
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2022
reviews.review: The wipes are soapy,if you squeeze on you can see the white bubblie liquid come out. It leaves behind suds almost like soap lathered up and they are super wet so you feel like you have to wash your hands after. The only thing I can compare it to is soap. Definitely not somthing I want to wipe and leave liquid on my babies bottom with. They are good for wipeing hands, feet, and cleaning messes up with though!

reviews.title: SMALLER THINNER SHEETS
reviews.name: Gmakrissy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2021
reviews.review: I am 74, I've used these since before 2011. This last shipment I received is noticeably different. Each sheet is definitely thiner (they tear too easily), and each sheet is noticeably smaller. Very disappointed as this is the only brand you could count on to successfully clean off, whether it was your private area or your pits in-between shower days. In this assisted living facility we have two days a week to shower, I try to sneak one more day in. I realize when you produce a product you need to make a profit, but really, don't let that be your guide line, try to think of the people who use them..🤔🤑🤨😒🙏🙏

I got two boxes and planning to get more.

reviews.review:
Goods:

Good price
A lot of wipes

Bad:

Rough
Dry
Short shelf life

Overall:

Look elsewhere

Huggies recently changed the this product to a more cheaper quality wipe. They changed the packaging to a cheaper top, and thinned out the wipe. The top is more likely to break, and the wipe is more dry and rough. I won’t be buying this product this time around. I’ll try other competing brands.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2024
reviews.review: I don’t know how they manage to be soapy and dry at the same time but they are horrible. I wiped my son when I changed him and it was soapy all over. Then I tried to clean his face and the wipes were oddly dry. I have used Huggies before but they’ve never been like this. It’s like I washing him with a soapy rag. Yuck

reviews.title: Quality has declined on these too!
reviews.name: SLM
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2024
reviews.review: These are awful. They are thinner than the last ones I bought. They wont work in the pop up dispenser. They won’t come out one at a time. They are literally stuck together as if they were glued so you either have to tear off a chunk to use, peel the clumped sheets apart (contaminating them), or have to use multiple sheets at one time. Good luck trying to get one out one handed. About halfway through the first package, they got a little better, but they still won’t work in the dispenser. I still have some of the good ones left from my last case, so I know I’m not crazy!

reviews.title: Crispy and leaves fluff
reviews.name: Kaneko
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2024
reviews.review: Hate these wipes. They're thin and crispy, making it extremely difficult to actually wipe anything off my baby's rump. They are not absorbent at all and tear easily. They also leave pieces of material everywhere you use them, which is awful when you're trying to clean your baby's face or neck. She just becomes covered in little white fluffs.

reviews.title: Missing
reviews.name: Granny
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2024
reviews.review: One pack of wipes was missing, 11 packs not 12.

reviews.title: Fast delivery
reviews.name: Such a beautiful dress!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2024
reviews.review: I have a subscription may change. Wipes are not as wet as other wipes i have used

reviews.title: Small, cheap, tear easily; buy Pampers instead
reviews.name: Book Reader
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2024
reviews.review: Need to use two at a time, so no bargain. Regret purchasing.

reviews.title: Meh
reviews.name: Jamandjelly
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2024
reviews.review: I bought these as they were a bit cheaper than the Amazon wipes I buy. They were disappointing. Not that substantial and it takes quite a few to get the tush clean. Not buying again.

reviews.title: No longer soft
reviews.name: Laeeqa
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2024
reviews.review: I bought a pack of the huggies wipes before and they were great. Nice and soft and a great value for your dollar. But now they feel different. They are durable, nice and big, little scent, but they feel rough on the skin and not as absorbent as before. Did they didnt change the ingredients? Idk wish they were more soft and absorbent.

reviews.title: Great price
reviews.name: tina whittington
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2024
reviews.review: The wipe quality was great. Very effectness. Would buy again

reviews.title: Not soft
reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2024
reviews.review: Huggies wipes are not made like when I had babies. These are thin and little rough. I will not buy them again

reviews.title: Dry and inconvenient
reviews.name: Alex
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2022
reviews.review:
Each sheet from each package is drier than comparable sheets from other companies. This makes you end up having to use more sheets per change/less comfortable for the baby you are changing.

All of us who bought these, clearly bought them for the cost/quantity ratio, but I would not make that mistake again.

The worse part of these, is that when you go to use a wipe and tug one out of the packaging, about 5 more get pulled out with it and they do not detach from each other the way they should.

So here we are, trying to change a baby that is squirming all around and trying to pull out one sheet at a time and five more come out attached and you have to shake them vigorously to be able to use just the one you wanted (while the other four fall randomly around the room), only to feel that is is drier than it should be so it does not clean like it should.

reviews.title: Rough and harsh on messes
reviews.name: JLeigh
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.review: These wipes have good clean ingredients but they are rough on the skin. I have to scrub to get off messes. It’s not worth it. I wish I bought one to test it out first instead of a large pack. Do not be like me if you are trying for the first time. Test to see if you like the texture of the wipe. I am going back to Pampers.

reviews.title: Used to be better
reviews.name: asterismW
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2022
reviews.review: I've been getting the Simply Clean wipes since my first kid was a baby, and they've always been decent. Not wonderful, but for a family on a budget, they were fine. But now, after 4+ years, they've changed the wipes. They are thinner and leave bits on my 3rd baby's bum. This happened when they changed the art on the packaging, and have Mickey riding a bubble. I still have some of the older wipes, and there is a definite difference. The picture shows the better wipes in the old packaging on the left, and the worse wipes in the new packaging on the right. (I tried to get a picture of the wipes too, but you can't really see the difference in quality. It's more of a feel thing.) I hope Huggies goes back to the way they were before, because now these are almost too cheap to be useful.

reviews.title: These just shred
reviews.name: Manda
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2024
reviews.review: When you go to pull a wipe out, they just tear and you end up pulling them out in pieces. Not ideal in the middle of a poopy diaper change.

reviews.title: Dry and not soft
reviews.name: Christina
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2022
reviews.review:
They are extremely dry so it does not clean well when baby has a really messy diaper. You have to wipe more to get them clean since it’s dry which causes their butt to get irritated. I used these first with my newborn, and with irritation doctor recommended using a butt paste. I started using a butt paste and I ended up switching wipes. My babies irritated butt healed. I switched back to these wipes and still used the butt paste. It’s only been 2 days and he has an irritated butt again! Sadly I just missed the return window for the unopened box I have by 4 days… The material is thicker though compared to some competitors in the same price range which makes it nice and durable.

I will not be buying these again. I have another type of huggie brand wipes that I’m scared to use that I got from my baby shower, so we will see..

reviews.title: Cheap quality
reviews.name: LUIS ALDAS
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2023
reviews.review:
I've been using Costco brand since my baby was borned. But I ran out of babywipes and I decided to order this since it will get here next day. After comparing it to Costco I realized that Costco are much better.
Costco are much stronger, hold the moisture longer and are a little wider.
I use the wipe warmer and Huggies dry quickly leaving it like a napkin. I don't have that issue with Costco' wipes.
And once you order Huggies, they can't be returned in amazon. So stay away from them and start using Costco. It's almost the same price.

reviews.title: Not very soft
reviews.name: Rachelle Nichols
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2024
reviews.review: These wipes are pretty rough and not too soft. Maybe would be ok for use on an older baby or for hands or wiping faces but I feel like they are not soft enough for a newborn baby’s skin. Won’t be buying these again.

reviews.title: Wipes are rough
reviews.name: Katrina Sabata
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2024
reviews.review: The wipes are very rough so if a baby has irritated skin, it’s going to hurt to use these wipes. There’s a lot of friction between the wipe and the skin which I don’t like. For the price paid, I will switch brands.

reviews.title: Breaks apart won’t buy again
reviews.name: John Pavlish
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
reviews.review:
I wouldn’t buy these again. The shoes fall apart when you try to take them out and don’t unfold easily. The cover for the bag also easily breaks allowing the wipes to dry up.

The only benefit I found was the bag size was ideal for our diaper backpack as the larger bags from Amazon or Costco which have 100 counts just can’t fit in our travel setup.

reviews.title: All wipes stuck together
reviews.name: Paula
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2024
reviews.review: Everytime you go to pull one wipe 3 come out it’s obnoxious even with a weighted wipe dispenser. Other brands don't do this.

reviews.title: Functional, but kind of dry
reviews.name: J.L.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2022
reviews.review:
With twins I use a lot of diaper wipes. And have tried a lot of brands. These wipes made by huggies were pretty dry like they had been left out for a few hours. They felt this was right out of the package. We ordered a whole box and every package was like this, not just a single package.

They were functional. But we ended up using more each diaper change because being more dry causes the need to use more. So we went through them faster.

Smart selling tactic, I guess. But there are many brands I find work quite a bit better and also use less wipes. The best wipes I've tried are water wipes, and surprisingly the UP & UP brand from target.

reviews.title: Really Abrasive
reviews.name: Mama Bean
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2023
reviews.review: I don’t know if anyone noticed but these Huggies wipes in particular are really abrasive! Unfortunately these wipes are too rough for my LO and even for myself! I’ve tried wiping my face with these and it’s like using a Noxzema pad for acne. It often gave my LO a rash and is not good overall. I’m sure it may work well for others but if you notice your LO with a rash and you’re using these, try switching! Shoutout to Amazon though for the quick and efficient delivery :)

reviews.title: Meh
reviews.name: Madi Hamilton
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2024
reviews.review: not very wet. I had to use more than usual because they aren’t as wet.

reviews.title: Terrible wipes
reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2024
reviews.review: They don't feed one wipe to the next, they don't separate easily, and they are not very soft or flexible. Basically they only get a second star because they do at least wipe.

reviews.title: NOT FOR SENSITIVE SKIN AT ALL
reviews.name: Bianca
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2022
reviews.review: After purchasing 3 cases of this product they were delivered quickly overnight. However, once I opened them and took a single wipe out it felt stuff and rough. It kind of reminded me of the thin rough paper towels that you'd find in public bathrooms. My husband liked them because they were cheap but I immediately knew they were going to be trouble. After less than a day of use my daughter developed a rash and would cry/whimper when I wiped her. I think these wipes would be a great and inexpensive wipe for hands when she starts eating solids or for a baby who doesn't have sensitive skin but if you it baby has sensitive skin DO NOT GET THESE WIPES!!!

reviews.title: Not what they used to be
reviews.name: Natalie
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2022
reviews.review: I've bought Huggies simply clean wipes for a long time because my kids are sensitive to the citric acid in almost all other wipes. These are the only affordable ones that don't have it. I'm very disappointed that the last several boxes I've bought have been so linty/shedding that I'm constantly having to clean wipe fuzz off of my kids after wet wiping them. The wipes have also been very scratchy/rough textured. It's making me really consider not buying this brand anymore.

reviews.title: Box came open
reviews.name: irving arias
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2024
reviews.review: I'm subscribe to buggies.. it always come closes good condition..today I got my delivery and it was open and missing wipes a small box

reviews.title: They get stuck together.
reviews.name: No name.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2024
reviews.review: I bought a lot of them but recently it's a rip off. Some of the lids are off. Wipes get stucked and break easily.

reviews.title: It leaves lints on baby’s butt, and makes the skin red all the time
reviews.name: ginboy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2023
reviews.review:
I was trying around different diaper wipes. I don’t like this one because it leaves lint on my baby’s butt. Other than that, she would constantly have diaper rash no matter how we care for it.

After trying many other products as well, I eventually went back to water wipes because that’s the only diaper wipe that doesn’t give her a diaper rash. Cheap wipes didn’t work for us… sigh…

reviews.title: Poor quality
reviews.name: Patricia Harrington
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.review: I wanted to use these as they have a high rating on Yuka. However, they are stiff and rough. I have to add water to soften them up and that only helps a little. I would not use these on a baby's bottom, again too rough and stiff.

reviews.title: A bit dry and too thick
reviews.name: Xxthirteen
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2019
reviews.review: A bit of an odd use for these as I’m sure most use them for babies but I have a very unique ostomy situation and so I need to keep my skin clean and use baby wipes to do the job. I bought these on a whim when my supply of my usual was getting low and I couldn’t get to the store to get more. These didn’t really hold up to my expectations of the brand. They were rather thick which I’m sure would be alright for some but I prefer a little thinner, and they were also very dry. Which made cleaning rather difficult and made you use more than you really should have needed to use. I love the hard plastic closure piece though! And it truly has no scent and works great for sensitive skin but I probably wouldn’t buy these again and it just feels wasteful.

reviews.title: Feels like a paper towel
reviews.name: Rachel Kiester
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2024
reviews.review: I'll probably still use these for cleaning, but not on babys bottom! Very rough and harsh. Gave him a rash.

reviews.title: Too thick and flimsy at the same time.
reviews.name: B. A.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2022
reviews.review: They are cheap and they feel cheap. Technically they work, I just don't like them. They do not absorb baby poop, are hard to fold, your finger easily goes through it, and they do not pull the next one through the dispenser, you have to fish for it almost every time. If you are just looking for the cheapest option they will work, I just don't like or recommend them that is why 2 stars instead of just one.

reviews.title: Texture
reviews.name: Isabella
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.review: I really hate the texture of these, they feel more like a wipe you’d us to clean a counter top rather than a baby

reviews.title: Ehh
reviews.name: Cinnamon
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2024
reviews.review: I feel like they dry out too quick

reviews.title: Drying
reviews.name: Brittany Dendy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2023
reviews.review: They are rough on my babies skin. Like they are dry if that makes sense. When I go to wipe her it’s actually causing her to have diaper rash. It’s not soft. I have to wipe gently to make sure I’m not basically tearing her skin with these.

reviews.title: Wipes rip apart easily during use unfortunately
reviews.name: Morgan Moore
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2022
reviews.review: I’m a huge Huggies Diaper fan, but I did not like these wipes. When I first received these wipes, I was excited to see how they would work. While changing my little one’s diaper, these wipes would rip apart unexpectedly and I had to use multiple wipes in place of one. The texture feels similar to a wet paper towels with dish soap. I wasn’t a fan sadly, and these wipes are non-returnable.

reviews.title: Gave my baby the WORST diaper rash
reviews.name: Lexi
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2023
reviews.review: They rip apart when trying to pull them out of my wipe warmer. They also gave my baby the WORST diaper rash I’ve ever seen. It took almost two weeks to heal. Guess I’ll be keeping the rest of these packs in the car for hands only.

reviews.title: They don't pull out properly and fall apart easy.
reviews.name: Crystal
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2021
reviews.review: I'm not one to leave poor reviews, but these wipes are awful. Yes, they are wet, clean, and dont cause my toddlers skin to turn red, but I am giving the rest of them away because they cause too much frustration. I have to take them apart ahead of time because the seam is hard to find, and the WORST is that one wipe does not follow the next like every single other type ive tried. They come out individually. So its --dig around to find the seam, pull it out gently so it doesn't tear apart, dig around in package for the next. Definitely disappointed by such a poor Huggies product.

reviews.title: Blah
reviews.name: cryptickitten19
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2022
reviews.review: I haven’t used Huggies wipes in a year or so and figured I would try these Simply Clean fragrance free ones as my son has a fragrance allergy. Unfortunately these wipes feel like damp cardboard and are extremely rough. I’m not sure how you’re supposed to use these on a baby’s butt when my toddler was saying ow just from wiping his hands. I’m very disappointed in Huggies for these wipes, even if they were on sale.

reviews.title: Stiff and dry
reviews.name: Real Mf Critic
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.review: Not what wipes are supposed to be these wipes are stiff and some of these packs were dry wouldn’t recommend

reviews.title: Drying
reviews.name: Jenna
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.review: These wipes dry out my son’s skin. They fall apart and cause diaper rash- don’t recommend.

reviews.title: Not for sensitive skin babies
reviews.name: Arika Hefner
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2022
reviews.review: Everytime I get these wipes they give my baby diaper rash and rub her poor little butt raw. They are very tough and dry and I usually have to add water to them to soften them up enough to use them. They are great if you want to use them to wipe down hands or other stuff but they are very tough on my babies skin. I'll stick to Huggies or Pampers sensitive skin wipes even if they are a little more expensive.

reviews.title: They're different now!!!😭
reviews.name: Leslie Anne
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2023
reviews.review: They've changed!!! I've been buying these for so long BECAUSE one side was just a little bit "griddy" compared to the other side, and I would use that side to gently exfoliate my face. I just opened the new box and they're different! No griddy side. I'm so disappointed.😔

reviews.title: Poor quality
reviews.name: K. Zoe
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2023
reviews.review: These wipes rip apart easily and also leave behind tiny pieces on skin. This seems like a great deal compared to other brands but you need to use double the amount of wipes so not worth it

reviews.title: Don’t like these
reviews.name: laurel white
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.review: I do not like these, I love everything Huggies but these wipes are terrible. They are not soft and are a weird material. They are also kinda dry. The only good thing is they are unscented.

reviews.title: CHANGED!!!!!!!
reviews.name: Dave
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2024
reviews.review:
These were so thick and soft

They are now THIN & ROUGH!

reviews.title: Solid wipes
reviews.name: Oso
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2024
reviews.review: Works ok

reviews.title: Scratchy but moist, large, durable & effective. But scratchy sways me
reviews.name: TXAnimals
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2022
reviews.review: These wipes are larger than most store brands and folding on in half gives a nice buffer from what you're wiping. They are effective and don't have a strong scent. But, they are really scratchy. Given these have 2 major kid-centered brands plastered all packaging, I ended up being disappointed and searching for another option. I thought the brands meant they were a superior product. While the scratchiness is my only "rub" with these wipes, I expect more when I purchase what I think is a premium product from well-known brands.

reviews.title: these tear easily when pulling out of packager
reviews.name: SK
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2023
reviews.review: I won't buy again because the sheets tear very easily when pulling them out of package to use them. Almost every sheet tears so I won't buy again.

reviews.title: They are now very thick
reviews.name: mrwintr
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
reviews.review: I guess some people complained they were too thin....maybe that is why they are so dang thick now. You ruined a good product in my opinion.

reviews.title: Dry
reviews.name: Jessica
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2023
reviews.review: In my opinion, these wipes are dryer than most and they cosntntly ripped as I was trying to pull them out of the container and use them. Which leaves you fishing out the smaller, broken pieces. Even walmart's brand of wipes did seem better than these.

reviews.title: They Easily Rip Apart
reviews.name: M. Anthony
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.review: As I take these from the container they rip and fall apart. I won't buy them again

reviews.title: Leaking to often
reviews.name: A Buyer
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.review: I don’t know why but this leaks often and it also caused a big rash on the skin of my baby.

reviews.title: Causes diaper rash but good price
reviews.name: Emily
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2023
reviews.review: The price for these wipes is good however they are very rough and gave my baby terrible diaper rash. We stopped using on our baby and will just use them in the bathroom and for cleaning up hands.

reviews.title: A little rough
reviews.name: Abby Tesar
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2023
reviews.review: These wipes are not as soft as other wipes I've used, even the Amazon brand wipes seem quite a bit softer. They have good moisture, but due to the roughness it feels like I have to wipe harder on my babys sensitive little booty which I don't like!

reviews.title: Not Bad
reviews.name: Pamela M. Jaslowski
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2022
reviews.review: These come in 2 different packaging types. One has an oval top, one has a round top. the ones in the round top don't come out as easily, and they also seem to be thinner. Overall, they work well. Decent for the price. Problem is, you never know which one you will receive.

reviews.title: Cheap, flimsy, and not very soft wipes
reviews.name: Julian W.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2022
reviews.review: Thought a baby wipe was a baby wipe. Opted for a case of these since they were a little cheaper than the others but I guess you really do get what you pay for. These are the worst wipes hands down I’ve ever used. They are definitely not the softest wipes and they also tend to fall apart if you have some light scrubbing to do with them. Will never buy this garbage again. Pampers all the way!

reviews.title: Paper thin
reviews.name: babeinsouthpark
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2022
reviews.review: I was not impressed with the wipes. I would rather stick with Hello Bello or Costco Kirkland brand. These wipes are paper thin and rip when you try to take them out of the package. They are small and are rough like paper when trying to wipe. I will not be buying Huggies wipes again.

reviews.title: Gave my baby a bum rash
reviews.name: KB14
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2022
reviews.review: I use Huggies Natural Care wipes normally and I love them. I got a deal on these, so I decided to give them a try. These wipes are not super moist and really gritty. They clean well, but my baby had a rash form way too quickly and it got bad fast. He hasn’t had any issues after we switched back to Huggies Natural Care wipes. We will not be buying these again.

reviews.title: disappointed
reviews.name: catelyn k
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2023
reviews.review: I usually get Nourish but not available. These are smaller, thinner and tear easily getting out of the container. Won't be buying again.

reviews.title: Something is Different
reviews.name: Taylor
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2022
reviews.review: I love quilted wipes over the cloth-like ones, and these are just that. However, they seem to be much rougher than previous packs. I don't know if they've changed something or if I just got a bad batch, but be aware. The Huggies Natural Care might be the way to go if you want a quilted wipe that isn't stiff.

reviews.title: Eh
reviews.name: Victoria
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.review: Rough wipes. A lot of them but they aren’t very soft.

reviews.title: Gave my child Hives
reviews.name: Tori
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2022
reviews.review:
Not only do these wipes leave little white strands on my sons skin but he has now started to break out into HIVES in the places I wipe him with these. I would not recommend these wipe to anyone. They are cheap quality and are not good for your Childs skin.
I haven't had this problem with any other wipes either.

reviews.title: Fall apart!
reviews.name: Faithbnc
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2022
reviews.review: I can't even get them out of the package without falling apart! Driving me crazy! I've bought tons of different wipes in the 6 years I've been using them on my kids and these are one of the worst so far! Wish I hadn't bought the big pack, don't know what I'll do with them! Amazon brand, Costco, Sam's club, and most any store brand are better than these!

reviews.title: Too rough
reviews.name: Jeffrey Billings
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2023
reviews.review: These wipes were too rough and gave my infant a rash. Don't know if they are better on older babies and that's why there's so many good reviews? It's too bad I can't use them because they are cheaper than other wipes.

reviews.title: Always tear!
reviews.name: Grace Fox
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2022
reviews.review: It's so hard to get them out of the package without them tearing. They're super flimsy and tear extremely easily. I use these for my 12yo who is disabled, so wipes for us need to be strong and capable. These basically disintegrate at the slightest tension. Never buying these again.

reviews.title: Just didn't like them...
reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2021
reviews.review: Do not like these wipes at all. I thought they would be like the Huggies wipes I'm used to, but they aren't. They aren't as durable, and the feel of them isn't as nice. They rip more easily. They seem soapy while simultaneously too dry. Just don't like them for wiping dog feet and other cleaning. I'll stick with my Huggies Natural Care in the future. Seller was great, this is about the product itself (only).

reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
reviews.name: Lauren Hope Wells
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2023
reviews.review: These are so thin. They rip, they just overall aren’t good baby wipes. Save some money & buy the Amazon brand wipes instead.

reviews.title: Wipes are like sand paper
reviews.name: DredgeFam
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2023
reviews.review: The wipes have a rough texture and it’s hard to wipe off poop. They need more moisture in them or something.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2022
reviews.review: Wow I honestly didn't expect this Wipes to be so harsh 😳 and cheap looking. This is after all for babies. But I tried using one and wow they feel like a wet paper towel and it leaves trace of linen behind. I wouldn't even use this on my baby.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2024
reviews.review: I have used Huggies on all my children. I've used them exclusively on my 18-month-old since he was born. I always buy from the store, never online. This was my first time buying online and I was glad to find these at the lowest price for Huggies. Upon using the first wipe, I was disappointed because it was CLEARLY not made from the same material. I had a pack of store-bought Huggies wipes on hand and compared them. These wipes felt like hard, wet paper. The store-bought wipes were much softer, more like fabric. I decided to get over it since I paid for 704 wipes, and didn't want to waste them. I would just make sure to buy it from the store next time. Now, after using the wipes for several days, my baby is breaking out in a diaper rash. This NEVER happens! I know rashes happen, but this is my 4th baby and I've learned to prevent them. The store-bought Huggies wipes NEVER does this. These wipes are not the same and I do not recommend them.

reviews.title: Baby butt rash! Rough Wipes :(

reviews.review: These wipes are AWFUL! I have no clue how they have almost 5 starts instead of 1. Save your babies butt and DO NOT buy these. They are rough almost like sandpaper and tear so easily I could barely get one out. I thought I'd buy them because they were a little cheaper then pampers, my mistake. FYI I only used half a pack before getting rid of them. #zerostar #huggiessuck

reviews.title: Gave my baby horrible diaper rash!!!!

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2024
reviews.review: I normally buy the Rico wipes from Costco or Kirkland brand but we’ve tried several other brands as well. My baby is not sensitive and has never had a diaper rash ever and she is 7 months. I ordered these wipes and we’ve been using them for two days now and she has such a bad diaper rash that she’s bleeding 😞😞😞 I already was contemplating returning them because the quality isn’t good anyways (wipes falling apart, not very moist, texture,etc… but now I am definitely returning these and will never use them on my baby ever again😭 I’m so sad she is crying in pain her bottom hurts so bad…

reviews.title: Save your money for higher quality wipes instead
reviews.name: Ashley W
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2024
reviews.review:
I purchased these for my 3yo for hand wipes and for traveling so quick wipes for her face, after the park etc.

DO NOT RECOMMEND for those actually needing these for diaper changes.

The texture and quality are akin to those cheap, lemon scented hand sani-wipes from restaurants.
Easily rips. Feels like wet paper towel.

I could not imagine using these for diaper changes as its one swipe and you need a new one (so you’ll go through a package fast).
Also, I am not confident that my fingers are safe from baby poop using these because wiping my daughter’s mouth with just one, I easily tore the wipe I was using.

reviews.title: Sandpaper
reviews.name: Queen Anne
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2022
reviews.review: I bought these for my newborn baby, but also had several packs of Pampers brand baby wipes I had received from the hospital. I also use baby wipes whenever I wash my face and for makeup removal. So once the Pampers wipes were finished I started using these Huggies wipes. They are like wet paper towels and I didn't know how rough they were until I started using them on my face. They feel really rough and I would not recommemd them for baby's sensitive bottoms or skin. It is too abrasive especially to use down there since you are CONSTANTLY changing baby's diaper and each time you are having to wipe and clean their delicate skin which is constantly being exposed to wetness and poop. Believe me, your baby's bottom is going to start looking a little red if you continue to use these, they are simply too rough. They rip very easily also. They are like a glorified wet wipe, the kind you sometimes get when you order food, but rougher. They get dry fast as well. As you start wiping with it, the surface of the wipe begins to almost ball up and become more abrasive like you're exfoliating. I would recommend these for keeping in the car to clean a toddler's hands if they are messy, but definitely not for a newborn and definitely not for washing your face and definitely not for wiping your car's dashboard (they will leave lint and fibers galore!) I will be switching to a softer more gentler baby wipe.

reviews.title: They changed them, SUPER thin now.
reviews.name: Anon
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2024
reviews.review:
These are just garbage now. Due to "greedflation" they are now thinner and not nearly as strong as before. We thought it wad just a bad batch but for over 4 months they're NOTICABLY thinner. We compared them to al older pack we had in the camper and there's a huge difference. These recently produced wipes a finger can poke through easily, order not at all.

Going to a different brand now because this is absolute nonsense. ... Go UP in price AND reduce quantity.

SHAME ON HUGGIES!

reviews.title: what happened?! super scratchy and linty now - just terrible!
reviews.name: C.M. & T.M.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviews.review: We have been using these wipes for YEARS since my 18 year old first came home. We kept on using them because we all like to be super clean. These wipes used to be thick, smooth and silky and not irritate skin. The last few cases (the ones made in the US, sadly- they used to be made in Mexico) have been horrifying- literally like sandpaper- actually caused bleeding. They also fall apart and are linty. I understand sustainability but this feels like severe cost cutting. If you use these and your babies are getting fussy during diaper time, make sure that it's not these wipes. I mean, we're all grown ups and they feel awful to us, I can't imagine how rough and painful they are on a baby multiple times a day.

reviews.title: 🚨CANNOT RETURN🚨 Thin material. Irritates the face
reviews.name: Adam J. Locascio
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2023
reviews.review: The price was right on these wipes. I thought I was saving myself a trip to Sam’s Club. First and foremost, the wipes are very thin. Your finger will push right through the material into the nasty stuff depending on what you were doing. My wife tried to use one of the wipes to takeoff her make up. It ended up irritating her skin near her eyes and making them water for about 12 hours. I tried to do a return, but it turns out that you can’t return this item. I’m not sure why. There’s plenty of things on Amazon where if you try it out and the product is substandard and does not meet your expectations you can return it. For some reason, it Does Not apply to these wipes. So I guess I’m stuck with them. I’ll just give them this one star review and move on and never purchase it again. The Sam’s Club brand is so much better. And a little bit cheaper too.

Definitely won’t be buying again.

reviews.title: WORST wipes EVER
reviews.name: Christina Johnson
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2022
reviews.review:
I have four kids. I tried these with the first and HATED them. They rip when you pull one from the package-that’s IF you can manage to pull out only one. You can’t get a grip on it to pull out just one because they’re so thin- so you end up pinching the top of the wipes trying to get a grip to get one, and what always happens is a stack of 5-15 wipes come out with the top one usually ripped. If you DO manage to get one, that one will be ripped right in half, no exceptions. How have these wipes made it on the market for so long?!

So I didn’t use them at all for the second and third kids. Then for the fourth one, we ran out of pampers wipes so my husband ordered these wipes again. Oh my gosh, I remembered upon the first use exactly how much I hated these wipes- with the fire of a thousand suns. I have a box of 704 of these to go through before I can go back to my beloved pampers wipes. Ugh. Maybe I’ll give them away. But then I would feel bad for the parents I gave them to.

reviews.review: I normally use the pampers aqua pure wipes for my baby but I use Huggies diapers so I figured I would give their wipes a try while also saving money. In less than 12 hours my baby developed the worst ever rash, and his very first one since being born and he’s 7 weeks! I immediately knew it was the new wipes. I threw the rest away and had to door dash some pure wipes and the rash was gone in another 12 hours. How can these be safe for any baby’s sensitive bottom? Insane! I was so upset that my baby got his first rash from WIPES. Never again. I wouldn’t even use them on myself.

reviews.name: B.T
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2023
reviews.review: I've been buying these wipes for nearly 5 years, so I know what it's supposed to look and feel like. These new wipes are NOT the same. The newer ones are smaller and way thinner. I have to fold one of these wipes twice to get enough absorbency for my child; I didn't have to do that with the prior ones. I still have packs from my previous purchase, and if you look at the pictures, you can see the noticable difference. The pack with the oval top is bigger and thicker than the new pack with the round top. I don't know what kind of trickery Huggies is pulling, but I have definitely noticed. This will be my last purchase of Huggies wipes, which is sad, because I was very loyal to the brand.

reviews.name: BOBsMom
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2023
reviews.review:
We were gifted these in 2022 and they were fantastic back then. However, now, September 2023, the last two cases we bought of these, both this year - REEK. Instead of a fresh smell, it's chemical and leaves a very bad odor behind. Which is pretty much the opposite of what you use them for.

I understand supply chain disruptions etc. but there's no excuse for them to ship a product in this condition. These things clean up ok but they stink. I will be switching brands and I urge you not to buy these.

reviews.title: They Changed the Way These Wipes Were Made
reviews.name: Joeyy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2023
reviews.review:
I really liked this product. It was great. No weird scent. They were thick and durable. Compared to other wipes I used, these were what I believed to be the perfect product.

Sadly, they must be trying to save some money, as they are no longer the same product. There is less material being used, but probably the same amount of cleaning agent. This has resulted in a product that tears easily, and also doesn't separate properly when trying to remove it from the bag.

I was so happy to have found the original product, and I was going to continue buying these for life. Now, I'll have to find something new.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2022
reviews.review: These wipes felt slimy. They couldn’t even wipe poop off my baby’s butt. They gave him extreme diaper rash after the first use. He has eczema and the ones we normally order from Huggies were going to take a week to come in. So we tried these. And they are no good. I don’t understand how these can be considered sensitive I had to use almost a whole pack on one poop, and it wasn’t helping regardless. I don’t want to have to scape off stuff with a wipe, or continuously wipe back and forth and chafe my baby, I need something more helpful and these wipes aren’t it. I do like other huggie wipes tho but these are terrible.
